title: Levy Sekgapane
text:
Levy Sekgapane (born December 16, 1990) is a South-African <a href="opera">opera</a>tic <a href="tenor">tenor</a>.
The singer is a <a href="Bel%20canto">Bel canto</a> tenor whose repertoire includes roles in operas by <a href="Gioachino%20Rossini">G. Rossini</a>, <a href="Gaetano%20Donizetti">G. Donizetti</a>, <a href="Wolfgang%20Amadeus%20Mozart">W. A. Mozart</a>, <a href="Johann%20Sebastian%20Bach">J. S. Bach</a>.
Sekgapane was named the 30 Under 30 Europe 2018: Arts & Culture by the Forbes magazine.
Early life and education.
Levy Sekgapane was born (December 16, 1990) in <a href="Kroonstad">Kroonstad</a> South Africa. He graduated from the <a href="South%20African%20College%20of%20Music">South African College of Music</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Cape%20Town">University of Cape Town</a>.
Participation in international vocal competitions.
Levy Sekgapane obtained the 1st prize at the <a href="International%20Hans%20Gabor%20Belvedere%20Singing%20Competition">International Hans Gabor Belvedere Singing Competition</a> as well as the 1st prize at the <a href="Montserrat%20Caball%C3%A9">Montserrat Caballé</a> International Singing Competition in 2015. In the summer of 2017, he won the 1st prize at Plácido Domingo's <a href="Operalia%2C%20The%20World%20Opera%20Competition">Operalia</a>, the World Opera Competition.
Artistic activity.
The singer's stage activity began in Chemnitz (Germany) in 2014 when he sang the role of Don Ramiro in Rossini's "<a href="La%20Cenerentola">La Cenerentola</a>." During the season 2015/16 he became a member of the Young Ensemble of <a href="Semperoper">Semperoper</a> in Dresden. The following season he performed the roles of Don Ramiro, Count Almaviva ("<a href="The%20Barber%20of%20Seville">Il barbiere di Siviglia</a>") and Lindoro, at <a href="Teatro%20Massimo">Teatro Massimo</a> in Palermo, <a href="Bavarian%20State%20Opera">Bavarian State Opera</a>, <a href="Hamburg%20State%20Opera">Hamburg State Opera</a> and Aalto-Musiktheater Essen. He also appeared at <a href="Royal%20Danish%20Theatre">Royal Opera Copenhagen</a>, where he sang the role of Il Conte di Libenskof in a new production of Rossini's <a href="Il%20viaggio%20a%20Reims">"Il Viaggio a Reims"</a> (2017).
Levy Sekgapane also performed at opera festivals: the <a href="Rossini%20Opera%20Festival">Rossini Opera Festival</a> in Pesaro singing the roles of Albazar in <a href="Il%20turco%20in%20Italia">"Il turco in Itali"a</a> (2016) and Selimo in <a href="Adina%20%28opera%29">"Adina"</a> (2018), the Whitsun Festival at <a href="Hessisches%20Staatstheater%20Wiesbaden">State Theatre Wiesbaden</a> when he debuted as Nemorino in Donizetti's <a href="L%27elisir%20d%27amore">"L’elisir d’amore"</a> (2018), the international <a href="https%3A//www.donizetti.org/en/festival-donizetti/">Donizetti Opera festival</a> in Bergamo singing the role of King Guido in Donizetti's "<a href="Enrico%20di%20Borgogna">Enrico di Borgogna</a>" (2018), <a href="Glyndebourne%20Festival%20Opera">Glyndebourne Festival</a> as Count Almaviva, <a href="Salzburg%20Festival">Salzburg Festival</a> as Arbace in Mozart's "<a href="Idomeneo">Idomeneo</a>" (2019) and lastly in the <a href="Wexford%20Festival%20Opera">Wexford Festival Opera</a> in the role of Selimo (2019)"."
On the concert stage he gave his debut at <a href="Elbphilharmonie">Elbphilharmonie</a> Hamburg singing in New Year's Eve gala. He took part in a concert dedicated to <a href="Maria%20Callas">Maria Callas</a> which was hosted by <a href="Th%C3%A9%C3%A2tre%20des%20Champs-%C3%89lys%C3%A9es">Theatre Champs-Élysées</a> in Paris. Sekgapane also performed in the AIDS Gala concert hosted annually at <a href="Deutsche%20Oper%20Berlin">Deutsche Oper Berlin</a> to support HIV and AIDS.
